intro: Scleria abortiva var. planifolia, commonly known as the flat-leaved bulrush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its flat, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikes of pale blue or white flowers. It typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, such as along stream banks or in swampy areas. The species is often used in wetland restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for various wildlife.
